intro: Psychotria hindsii, commonly known as the Hinds' psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. Psychotria hindsii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
